description: A trap describing the newly generated event or
alarm. The text in ggsnTrapDescription indicates
the nature of the problem.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GGSN-MIB::ggsnTrapNew GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmId i 9999 GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmName s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmTime t 31536000 GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmSourceId s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmObjectClass s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmObjectInstance s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmSeverity i 1 GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmDescription s EXAMPLE

description: A number uniquely identifying each event or alarm
in the Alarm Table.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmId

description: The name of the event or alarm.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmName

description: The value of sysUpTime when the event or alarm was sent.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmTime

description: The name of the event or alarm's originator.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmSourceId

description: The class of the network resources associated
with the event or alarm.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmObjectClass

description: The instance (of a class) of the network resource
associated with the event or alarm.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmObjectInstance

description: The perceived severity of the event. The value
unknown (0) is not recommended to be used.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmSeverity

description: A short textual explanation of the event or
alarm instance.
variables.name: GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmDescription

description: A trap indicating a change has occurred in the attributes of the alarm or event.
The text in ggsnTrapDescription indicates the nature of the change.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GGSN-MIB::ggsnTrapChanged GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmId i 9999 GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmName s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmTime t 31536000 GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmSourceId s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmObjectClass s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmObjectInstance s EXAMPLE GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmSeverity i 1 GGSN-MIB::ggsnAlarmDescription s EXAMPLE

description: A trap indicating the clear of the event or alarm.
